main_question: Which two fundamental freedoms are protected by the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms?
question: Which two fundamental freedoms are protected by the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms?
possible_answers: A. Freedom of belief and freedom of religion
B. Freedom of speech and freedom of the press
C. Freedom of peaceful assembly and freedom of association
D. Freedom to vote and freedom of movement within Canada
answer: A. Freedom of belief and freedom of religion
explanatory_sentence: Section 2 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms protects fundamental freedoms such as freedom of conscience and religion (belief), making option A the correct choice.
